solution_line_template: If the fan works for {minutes_per_day} minutes each day, in a week with {days_per_week} days, it will have worked for {minutes_per_day}*{days_per_week} = <<{minutes_per_day}*{days_per_week}={total_minutes}>>{total_minutes} minutes.

Since a minute has {seconds_per_minute} seconds, the total time in seconds that the fan will have worked in one week is {total_minutes}*{seconds_per_minute} = <<{total_minutes}*{seconds_per_minute}={total_seconds}>>{total_seconds} seconds.

Since the fan can create an airflow of {liters_per_second} liters per second, in {total_seconds} seconds, it will create an airflow of {total_seconds}*{liters_per_second}= <<{total_seconds}*{liters_per_second}={total_airflow}>>{total_airflow} liters.
